Fields.description: Fields provides optional filtering based on query string parameters specifying sparse fieldsets. Clients can pass 'fields[TYPE]' as a query parameter in order to specify which fields (comma separated values) are to be returned. All available fields not specified will be filtered out. Not specifying any fields filter returns all available fields. This param adheres roughly to the JSON:API https://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-sparse-fieldsets.
Fields.name: fields

FilterAuthDate.description:
Filter donations by the date/time they were recorded where auth_date is a valid:
  - RFC3339 date/time (e.g. `2006-01-02T15:04:05-07:00`)
  - MySQL-style date/time (e.g. `2006-01-02 15:04:05`)
  - Date-only string (e.g. `2006-01-02`)

Supports `>`, `>=`, `<`, `<=` `=`, and `!=` comparison operators. Multiple auth_date filters can be used in
a single request (e.g. `?filter[auth_date]=<1996-12-18T16:39:57-08:00&filter[auth_date]=>1996-12-19T16:39:57-08:00`)

If the filter value uses the RFC3339 format, then the time zone specified in the filter value will be converted
to UTC and compared with the auth_date of the Donation in UTC. If the filter value uses one of the other supported
formats and therefore doesn't contain time zone details, the auth_date of the Donation will be converted to
the time zone it was recorded in and then compared with the filter value string. This allows for the flexibility
to include all donations based on the time zone setting of the organization at the time of the donation.

For example, let's say we have these 2 donations:
  - Donation A is recorded as `2024-01-01T02:00:00Z` with a time zone of `America/New_York` which would mean it
    was actually given at 21:00:00 on 12/31/2023 EST.
  - Donation B is recorded as `2024-01-01T05:00:00Z` with a time zone of `America/New_York` which would mean it
    was given at 00:00:00 on 1/1/2024 EST.

Since those donations were given, the organization has updated their time zone to `America/Los_Angeles`.

RFC3339:
  - `?filter[auth_date]=>2024-01-01T00:00:00Z&filter[auth_date]=<2024-12-31T23:59:59Z`:
    This would return both donations since we're comparing with UTC timestamps even though technically Donation A
    was given on the last day of the previous year due to the time zone offset.

  - `?filter[auth_date]=>2024-01-01T00:00:00-05:00&filter[auth_date]=<2024-12-31T23:59:59-05:00`:
    This would accurately only include Donation B since Donation A in the time zone offset specified was 3 hours
    before the specified time window.

  - `?filter[auth_date]=>2024-01-01T00:00:00-08:00&filter[auth_date]=<2024-12-31T23:59:59-08:00`:
    This would return 0 Donations since both Donation A and B occurred before the specified time window.

MySQL-style date/time:
  - `?filter[auth_date]=>2024-01-01 00:00:00&filter[auth_date]=<2024-12-31 23:59:59`:
  Since these strings don't contain a time zone offset, they will be compared to the auth_date in the recorded
  time zone. For Donation A that would be `2024-12-31 21:00:00` and Donation B would be `2024-01-01 00:00:00`.
  Comparing the values in this format would properly include Donation B but NOT Donation A.

Date-only:
  - `?filter[auth_date]=>2024-01-01&filter[auth_date]=<2024-12-31`:
  When a time isn't included, we will assume the beginning of the day for `greater-than` comparisons and the
  end of the day for `less-than` comparisons. The filters in this scenario would act as if you passed in
  `?filter[auth_date]=>2024-01-01 00:00:00&filter[auth_date]=<2024-12-31 23:59:59` and would properly include
  Donation B but NOT Donation A.

  - `?filter[auth_date]=2024-01-01`:
  This filter assumes you want everything processed for that day in the time zone it was recorded in. This
  filter is functionally equivalent to using `?filter[auth_date]=>2024-01-01 00:00:00&filter[auth_date]=<2024-01-01 23:59:59`
  and would properly only return Donation B.

  - `?filter[auth_date]=!2024-01-01`:
  This filter assumes you want everything NOT processed on that day in the time zone it was recorded in. This
  filter is functionally equivalent to using `?filter[auth_date|auth_date]=<2023-12-31 23:59:59|>2024-01-02 00:00:00`
  and would properly return Donation A but NOT Donation B.
FilterAuthDate.name: filter[auth_date]

FilterAuthDateMax.description:
Latest auth date to filter records by where auth_date is a valid:
  - RFC3339 date/time (2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00)
  - MySQL-style date/time (2006-01-02 15:04:05)
  - date only string
Supports the `=` operator only.
This filter is equivalent to using the less-than operator with the auth_date filter. See the `auth_date`
filter for details on how date/time strings are handled.
e.g. `?filter[auth_date.max]=2038-01-19T03:14:07-00:00` will return records before this date.
FilterAuthDateMax.name: filter[auth_date.max]

FilterAuthDateMin.description:
Earliest auth date to filter records by where auth_date is a valid:
  - RFC3339 date/time (2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00)
  - MySQL-style date/time (2006-01-02 15:04:05)
  - date only string

Supports the `=` operator only.
This filter is equivalent to using the greater-than operator with the auth_date filter. See the `auth_date`
filter for details on how date/time strings are handled.
e.g. `?filter[auth_date.min]=1996-12-19T16:39:57-08:00` will return records after this date.
FilterAuthDateMin.name: filter[auth_date.min]

FilterUpdatedAtMin.description:

FilterUpdatedAtMin.name: filter[updated_at.min]

Sort.description:
A comma-separated list of fields with directions.
There are two directions for sorting: ascending and descending. To specify a direction, prepend the field name with `+` for ascending or `-` for descending. Ascending (`+`) is implied if a direction (`+` or `-`) is not specified.
See [Sorting](https://api-docs.subsplash.net/#tag/Sorts) for more details.
Sort.name: sort

AcademicGrade.description: An object defining the user's academic grade. This field is not stored in the database, but is calculated based on the user's graduation_year.

name.description: The name of the academic grade (e.g. "4th").

value.description: The value or ID of the academic grade. Currently these values also correspond to grade order.

country.description: The country in which the address is located

street.description: The street name of the address

updated_at.description: Moment when the address was updated

Adjustment.description: An adjustment is a transfer of funds between two accounts (the main subsplash account and a client's connected account) within the payfac. This includes GrowCurve rebates and Month End Billing invoices.

changes.description: A collection of changes derived from the adjustments

created_at.description: Moment when the adjustment was created in UTC.

user.description: The user who initiated the change

cancelled.description: Indicates whether the app is cancelled

created_at.description: Moment when the app was created

deleted_at.description: Moment when the app was deleted

internal_title.description: The internal title of the app.

is_container.description: Indicates whether the app is a container

AppInstall.description: AppInstall holds the ID of a single app install (AppInstallID) for a particular user. Note that a user could have many AppInstallIDs (one for each device on which they have the app installed).

created_at.description: Moment when the attachment was created

AttendanceRes.description: Response of a resource that logs the attendance of group members (end-users) to events/sessions.

AuthProvider.description: An AuthProvider defines the details around a specific remote Identify Provider that will be used for authentication. There is a relationship of AuthProvider to a GO Struct that defines the specifics of how this auth provider functions.

auth_handler.description: Used by the app to identify the native handler that should be used to initiate the auth flow

basic_auth_creds.description: Used when the Identify Provider requires basic authentication. This is usually a requirement around custom third party Identify Providers in dev/stage

basic_auth_host.description: Used when the Identify Provider requires basic authentication. This is usually a requirement around custom third party Identify Providers in dev/stage

color.description: The color used when displaying the auth provider in the UI

content_domain.description:
A comma separated list of domains that the Identity Providers Access Token should be sent to when the app communicates with an endpoint on the domain.
when the app communicates with an endpoint on the domain.

is_global.description: Dictates whether an AuthProvider is globally scoped. Globally scoped auth providers do not require an AuthProviderContext, unlike normal login AuthProviders.

login_cookie_host.description:
When a user logs out in the app, it will clear all the cookies on the login_cookie_host for each auth
provider associated with the app. We currently only use this for enterprise auth providers like Ligonier
and Wild at Heart that have web views in the app with protected content, along with giving, for when an
end-user decides to log out, and we want to clear their cookies in the web view.

override_change_email_url.description: A URL the app can use to allow changing of an email at a custom Identity Provider.

override_change_password_url.description: A URL the app can use to allow changing of a users password at a custom Identity Provider.

platforms.description: A comma separated list of allowed platforms used to help filter configurations for specific platforms and platform versions. The filtering should occur in the feeds project. Currently allowed values can include web, ios and android, but more platform types can be added in the future. The order of the items in the list doesn't matter. If this value is null or empty (the default), then it's assumed that this AuthProvider is allowed for any and all platform types.

service_key.description: The key used when communicating with the Identity Provider.

service_name.description: The name that identifies this auth provider. This is used to map the auth provider to a class in GO.

service_secret.description: The secret used when communicating with the Identity Provider.

title.description: The title used when displaying the auth provider in the UI

trusted_login_service.description: When a user logs in with this Identity Provider but has previously logged in with a different identify provider using the same email address, then, IF the service is considered trusted, the accounts will be linked. If the Auth Provider is not considered trusted, we will not link the accounts.

verified_login.description: A flag attached to the access token that is used by our giving system to determine if the login provider can be trusted

AuthProviderContext.description:
An object that represents the relationship between an app_key and the Auth Provider. These are used to tell the system what AuthProviders are available for a specific app, as well as any app specific details.
for that auth provider (currently required for Apple)

AuthProviderReturnURL.description: An AuthProviderReturnURL defines a return URL that an authProvider allows to be used for user redirection at the end of their OAuth2 flow.

org_key.description: The organization to whom this client account belongs.

phone.description: An un-formatted phone number. Follows the E.164 standard which allows for up to 15 digits for a complete international phone number.

donation_count.description: The computed number of donations in this batch.

imported.description: Whether or not the batch was imported.

total.description: The total amount of donations in this batch.

Designations.description: A designation is a way for a user to specify that a percentage of their total gift will be directed towards a particular fund and campus.

amount.description: The amount of money that was designated to a fund and campus.

campus.description: Campuses are a way for clients to organize their funds. A client can have 0 to many campuses. A campus can have 0 to many funds.

fee.description: The amount of money in fees for a donation designated to a fund and campus.

fund.description: A fund is a way for clients to organize and group donations together. A fund (or sub-fund) can belong to a campus.

adjustments.description: A log of actions performed on this donation.

allOf.description: The batch this donation belongs to.

campuses.description: An array of campuses specified by the `designations` array.

funds.description: An array of Payment Funds specified by the `designations` array. Each fund may or may not have embedded its `parent-fund` or `sub-funds`.

parent-fund.description: The parent of this particular fund. See <https://openapi.docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Fund>.

instrument.description: The payment method for the donation. See <https://api.docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Instrument>.

last_four.description: The last four digits of the instrument identification number. This field will not appear for instruments with a type of `cash`, `check`, or `other`.

profile.description: The donor who gave the gift. See <https://openapi.docs.subsplash.net/end-user-auth/#tag/Profile>.

id.description: The unique identifier for this profile.

recurring.description: The time trigger details that were used to make this a recurring donation.

id.description: The unique identifier for this recurring detail.

allOf.description: The transfer details for this donation.

auth_date.description: Date the donation was received for donation entries, or the moment an ACH or card transaction was authorized.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created in UTC.

donor_covered_fees.description: Whether or not the donor decided to cover the processing fees.

frequency.description: The frequency of the donation indicates if the donation came from a recurring gift or one time gift.

has_adjustments.description: Whether or not this donation has been modified.

internal_notes.description: Notes left by the dashboard user.

memo.description: An optional message from the user.

org_key.description: The identifier for the owning organization.

short_id.description: A more human friendly, short, unique, integer id for the Donation.

status.description:
The current status or state of the donation.

- `paid`: An online donation that has been successfully transferred to the client's bank account.
- `batched`: An offline donation that has been batched successfully.
- `transfer pending`: An online donation that has been processed and is waiting to be transferred to a client's bank account.
- `pending`: A donation that is currently processing or awaiting capture.
- `failed`: A donation that has failed.
- `refunded`: A donation that has been refunded.
- `disputed`: An online donation that has been disputed by the donor as possible fraud/theft.
- `deleted`: A donation that has been deleted.

total_amount.description: The sum of the amounts for all the designations associated with this donation.

total_fee.description: The sum of the fees for all the designations associated with this donation.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated in UTC.

DonationTerminal.description: A donation terminal defines the configuration settings that should be used for accepting donations.

campuses.description:
A sorted list of campuses associated with this terminal. Campuses also includes a sorted list of funds that are available to the campus.

Campuses are only returned if the `short_code` filter is provided.
Campuses without published funds are excluded.

funds.description:
A sorted list of Payment Funds associated with this terminal. See <https://openapi.docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Fund>.

Funds are only returned if the `short_code` filter is provided.

payment_account.description: The base Payment Account resource. See <https://openapi.docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Account>. This will only be included when using the short_code filter, and will NOT include the payment_account rates "tier" value, due to account privacy considerations.

currency.description: The selected currency for the payfac for payouts. The set of valid codes are defined in [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217).

rates.description:
The rates information defines the base and customized fee options for a given payment account. The base rates are based on which tier (standard/giving_only) a client is a part of. The rate fee values are either percentage based or flat and apply when the platform executes payments of different types, using different instruments, and the payments service takes a portion of the amount transferred. The payments service controls what are known as the "base" rates, which are applied to the majority of accounts, but in some circumstances we negotiate custom rates with specific clients which the payments service applies on a per-account basis.

For example, if both credit.flat_fee and card.flat_fee are defined, but debit.flat_fee is not, then a payment with a credit card will use the rate from credit.flat_fee, but a payment with a debit card will use the rate from card.flat_fee because it's a type of card and there's no option defined for debit.flat_fee.

base.description: Our base rate values based on the value for the current tier. These values are used by the front end code when calculating the rates for donors-cover fees so that values for the custom rate negotiations aren't made public.

terminal.description: The base Payment Terminal resource. See <https://openapi.docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Terminal>.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created in UTC.

donor_address_required.description: Whether the address of the donor is required when creating new donations.

donor_choose_fund_enabled.description: Flag indicating if the donor has to choose a fund before giving.

donor_covered_fees_default_enabled.description: Whether the option for a donor to cover processing fees is selected by default or not.

donor_covered_fees_enabled.description: Whether to allow the donor to cover the cost of the fee for a given donation.

donor_memo_enabled.description: Whether to allow donor's to attach a memo to a donation.

engiven_crypto_enabled.description: Flag indicating if Engiven crypto donations are enabled for this terminal.

engiven_crypto_url.description: The Engiven crypto donation widget URL. Required when engiven_crypto_enabled is true.

engiven_stock_enabled.description: Flag indicating if Engiven stock donations are enabled for this terminal.

engiven_stock_url.description: The Engiven stock donation widget URL. Required when engiven_stock_enabled is true.

guest_giving_enabled.description: Flag indicating if the guest giving feature is enabled.

id.description: The unique identifier for this donation terminal.

in_app_giving_enabled.description: Flag indicating if the in-app giving feature is enabled.

org_key.description: The identifier for the owning organization.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was most recently updated in UTC.

DonationUpdateRequest.description: The update request for a donation.

EndUser.description: An EndUser is a representation of a person. An EndUser can represent both an online user who has authenticated through an Auth Provider OR an offline user that was created by a specific client to represent a person who interacts with their organization outside of the Subsplash ecosystem.

EndUserAuthData.description: EndUserAuthData has the credential details for the associated EndUser that are specific to the EndUser within the associated AuthProvider.

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document.

id.description: image associated with the repeating event

repeating-event.description: RepeatingEvent from which an event was generated.

check_in_enabled.description:
Indicates whether or not check-in is toggled on for this event.
Client is responsible for checking that there are valid sessions.

created_at.description: Date time when the resource was created

deleted_at.description: Date time when the resource was deleted, may be updated with proper roles

description.description: HTML or text description of the event.

description_text.description: Plain text description of the event.

domain.description: Domain of the event inherited from the calendar.

has_check_ins.description:
Indicates whether or not this event has any check-ins. This field
is updated via pubsub when a check-in is created. Not available via sdk.

ical_uid.description:
If the event corresponds to an iCal event, this field is the UID of
the event as it was in the iCal feed.

manually_edited.description: A flag indicating if this event has been manually edited by a user.

original_occurrence_date.description: Datetime of occurrence as set by repetition rule

published.description: a flag indicating if the calendar has been published or not

published_at.description: Date time when the resource was published

recurring.description: Indicates if an iCal event is recurring.

source.description: Indicates the source of the event.

updated_at.description: Date time when the resource was last updated

ExportJob.description: An ExportJob resource represents the process of compiling a list of profiles into a CSV file for clients to view their data.

ExternalUser.description:
Describes a user external to the Subsplash system using a user id known by an external system (auth provider) and the id of the
external auth provider. Note this object allows multiple external user ids as long as they are from the same auth provider.

auth_provider_id.description: Unique identifier of an auth provider

user_ids.description: An array of External user ids recognized by an auth provider

Form.description: The form resource is the foundational resource for building a form, and it contains the data required to display a form to an end user.

FormResponse.description: The response resource contains the information collected by end users when submitting a form.

answers.description: An object containing the data collected for each field.

field_id.description: The unique id of the form field the answer refers to.

field_type.description: The field's type from the form.

value.description: The string representation of the answer.

loaded_at.description: Time when the form was initially loaded by the end user.

Fund.description: A fund is a way for clients to organize and group donations together. A fund (or sub-fund) can belong to a campus.

FundCreateRequest.description: A request to create a fund.

offline_gift_total.description: The sum of all gifts given offline

online_gift_total.description: The sum of all gifts given online

FundUpdateRequest.description: A request to update a fund.

GraduationYear.description: The year the user will graduate, or graduated, high school. Used to calculate academic_grade.

Group.description: A Group object represent a group of GroupMembers

calendar.description: The calendar associated with the group.

group-members.description: Group members to add when Group is created. *Only returned on CREATE.*

location.description: The location associated with the group.

type.description: The group-type associated with the group.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

day_of_week.description: the day of the week that the group meets

description.description: a description of the group being represented

enrollment_type.description: the group enrollment type of new joiners

fluro_data.description: a hidden field used for additional fluro data included in this group

frequency.description: the frequency that the group meets

member_count.description: number of member in a group

member_limit.description: the maximum number of members allowed in the group

public.description: indicates if the group should be open to anyone to join (true) or only open to those invited (false)

restricted_invites.description: a closed group can be further restricted so that when the `restricted_invites` flag is set to true, only group managers can invite new members

time_of_day.description: the time of day that the group meets in 24 hour format (e.g. 0900, 1300, 2200)

timezone.description: the timezone in which a group meeting in valid IANA format.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated.

GroupMember.description: A GroupMember represents an individual member of a Group

end-user.description: The EndUser associated with this GroupMember

group.description: The Group to which the GroupMember belongs

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

messaging_status.description: the messaging status of a group member, invited by default, active once the group member has been successfully added to a group, banned is setup upon a ban action by a dashboard administrator, and the error status if something goes wrong adding the member to the chat channel.

role.description: the role a particular GroupMember has been assigned.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated.

GroupType.description: A GroupType represents a custom group type created by the user

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

name.description: the custom name of a particular GroupType.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated.

Household.description: The Household is a resource that represents an organization's view of a set of Profiles that represent a family. The data in this resource is completely owned by the client/organization, and edits are allowed by admins of the org.

address.description: The optional address for the Household.

guest-profiles.description:
The profile resources that are associated to the household as guests <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/#tag/Profile>.
Note that by default, the full profile resources aren't fetched, but only the id of the profiles are included.

members.description:
The related profile resources. <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/#tag/Profile>.
Note that by default, the full profile resources aren't fetched, but only the
id of the profiles are included.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

external_id.description: A free form string field that allows for clients to reference a household in any arbitrary external system by that system's unique identifier. This field cannot be edited by the client and is unique among non-deleted households within an Org.

fluro_data.description: a hidden field used for additional fluro data included in this group

name.description: The first name of the household.

org_key.description: The identifier for the owning organization.

primary_email.description: The primary email address of the household.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated most recently.

HouseholdRelationship.description:
A Household Relationship is a resource that represents a relationship between a Profile and a Household. A profile cannot be both a member of a household and have a Household Relationship to the same household.

A Household Relationship can be any of the following types:
- __Guest__: a Profile that is not a member of the household, but can be checked in to an event by a member of the household.
- __Trusted Person__: a Profile that is not a member of the household, but is allowed to check in any member of the household to an event. Trusted people have permissions to read the household resource data, including members data. Trusted people cannot modify household data nor can they modify profile data of members within households they are associated with.

HouseholdRole.description:
Indicates what role the profile plays in the household, if any.
- guardian = The profile is a guardian the household.
- parent = The profile is a parent in the household.
- child = The profile is a child in the household.
- other = The profile is not a parent or child.
- unknown = The profile's household role is unknown or cannot be mapped to a supported role.

HouseholdStatus.description:
The household's current status.
- active = Household is actively being used.
- archived = Household is not yet deleted so it is still accessible by users when specifically requested.
- draft = Household is hidden

Instrument.description: A Payment Instrument models an external money account to transfer funds to and from. This can be a Credit Card, Debit Card, bank account for ACH payments, which can be owned by (linked/related to) an end user or an organization. An instrument must be related to either a Payment User or an Account (having both is an option in the future, but not supported).

end-user.description: The End User that owns this Instrument.

payment-account.description: When an instrument is linked to an organization's account, this allows for payouts to that instrument. Only the bank account type is supported. An organization can have multiple accounts, and transfer funds to the same bank account.

payment-user.description: The Payment User that owns this Instrument. See <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/PaymentUser>

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

default.description: If this is the End User's default Payment Instrument for this particular Payment Account.

disabled.description: The instrument is disabled and cannot be used for payments in any way. This is used to stop suspected fraud during an investigation.

exp.description: The year and month that the card expires. Omitted for banks.

expiration.description: Use exp instead. The date that the instrument expires. Only applies to debit/credit cards.

external_id.description: The external id of the instrument.

institution_name.description: The name of the institution that backs the instrument.

last_four.description: The last four digits of the instrument identification number.

name_on_account.description: The name on the account to id the account.

one_time.description: True if this instrument should be for one time use only. This should only be written during create calls.

org_key.description: The identifier for the owning organization.

postal_code.description: The billing postal code for this instrument.

type.description: A type field to indicate what kind of instrument this is.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated most recently.

verification.description: Either two micro-deposit amounts or a descriptor code to verify ownership of this instrument.

InstrumentDescription.description: Optional details about the payment method (instrument_type) used. Example for Cash equivalent might be `30 shares of Apple stock`

InstrumentType.description: The type of payment instrument (e.g., Cash, Check, Other, etc.).

InstrumentVerification.description:
Instrument verification is either two micro deposits or a descriptor code to verify ownership of an instrument
by an end-user. When reading an instrument that needs verification, a type field will be present containing
either 'amounts' or 'descriptor_code' to inform the caller how to
verify.

JSONWebKey.description: A JSON data structure that represents a cryptographic key.

alg.description: Algorithm parameter - identifies the algorithm intended for use with the key.

e.description: The exponent value for an RSA public key. It is represented as a Base64urlUInt-encoded value.

kid.description: Unique identifier of this JSONWebKey within a JSONWebKeySet

kty.description: Key Type parameter - identifies the cryptographic algorithm family used with the key.

n.description: The modulus value for an RSA public key. It is represented as a Base64urlUInt-encoded value.

use.description: Public Key Use parameter - identifies the intended use of the public key.

JoinRequest.description: A JoinRequest represents the request properties to join a Group.

LatestMembershipStatusChange.description: A LatestMembershipStatusChange is a resource that represents the most recent Membership Status Change for a given Profile.

effective_on.description: The date the membership status change took place.

status.description: The name of the membership status to which the profile was changed. `null` means the status is unknown.

Link.description: A Link is a library item that represents a link to some external content.

app_key.description: ID of App that owns the resource.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

deleted_at.description: Moment when the resource was deleted.

destination_url.description: URL that the link points to.

has_tap.description: Whether the link has tap functionality enabled.

published_at.description: Moment when the resource was or will be published.

snappages_page_id.description: The ID of a snappages page the link is related to.

type.description: Type of the link that determines how it is opened.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was last changed.

href.description: A link to the current resource

ListBase.description: A resource to represent a list of non-homogeneous library items.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

generated.description: Indicates that the list was created by the system. This is done in certain situations, like when the content source of a [Web App](web_app.md) is based on filter and sort settings. Generated lists don't appear as library items; they are only used behind the scenes. Only used for dynamic lists. Defaults to `false`.

include_seriesless_media_items.description: Indicates if the list will include seriesless media items in it's contents.

list_rows_count.description: The number of list rows in the list, both published and unpublished. Only set for standard lists.

max_item_count.description: Maximum number of items to pull into a list.

published_at.description: Moment when the resource was or will be published.

short_code.description: Random string that uniquely identifies the resource.

sort_type.description:
Item sort method. Always `null` for standard lists. Allowed values:
  * `newest`: Most-recent to least-recent `created_at` values [default]
  * `oldest`: Least-recent to most-recent `created_at` values
  * `alphabetical`
  * `reverse_alphabetical`
  * `newest_date`: Most-recent to least-recent `date` values.
  * `oldest_date`: Least-recent to most-recent `date` values
  * `position` [**DEPRECATED**, not available for new lists or when updating list]
`newest_date` and `oldest_date` are only relevant for dynamic lists of Media Items. For lists of other types they behave the same as `newest` and `oldest`, respectively.

status.description: Publishing status of item. Draft is the default.

subtitle.description: Subtitle of the resource. Maximum length is 100 characters.

title.description: Title of the resource. Maximum length is 100 characters.

type.description: Type states how items are added to the list.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated.

ListCreateReq.description: A resource to represent a list of non-homogeneous library items.

type.description: Type states how items are added to the list.
Type states how items are added to the list.

_embedded.description:
With 'Create a ListRow' and 'Update a ListRow' endpoints, only one of the resource types below is required if creating or updated a ListRow where type=static.
With 'List ListRows' and 'Get One ListRow' endpoints, only one of the resource types below will be present in the response (describing the content of the ListRow)

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

deleted_at.description: Moment when the resource was deleted.

method.description:
Method by which to get the item for this list row Allowed values:
  * `static`: gets the item with the id and type set in the embedded resource [default]
  * `most_recent`: gets the most recent item of the type defined name in type
  * `second_most_recent`: gets the second most recent item of the type defined name in type

position.description: The row's position in the list.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated.

created_at.description: Moment when the location was created

deleted_at.description: Moment when the location was deleted

phone.description: The phone number of the location

updated_at.description: Moment when the location was updated

MICR.description: The MICR is a check hash record

MediaItem.description:
A Media Item is the basic resource used to combine video, audio, a document,
and metadata into one unit. Each one usually corresponds to a client's
sermon. Each media item may be associated with a Media Series.

broadcast.description: The linked Broadcast resource. When creating a new MediaItem, you can include the Broadcast resource to be created as well. When updating a MediaItem, you can include the Broadcast resource to be updated, but cannot create a new Broadcast or delete a Broadcast.

end_at.description: The time when the broadcast is specified to end at in UTC.

start_at.description: The time when the broadcast is specified to start at in UTC.

vod_m3u8_url.description: The url of the HLS asset's m3u8 manifest if created (this is about 3 minutes after the broadcast has stopped). Otherwise this field is omitted.

created-by-user.description: The user who created the resource.

live-template.description:
The linked LiveTemplate resource. When creating a media item, it's possible to pass a LiveTemplate ID to reference the LiveTemplate
that was used to create this media item.
See <https://api.docs.subsplash.net/live/#tag/LiveTemplate>

id.description: The unique identifier of the resource

notification.description: Integrated push notification for live stream.

items.description: A single restriction rule that can be applied to a media-item.

href.description: Dashboard link for the current resource
Embed link for the current resource
A link to the current resource
Share link for the current resource

auto_publish.description:
Indicates to automatically publish the media item when the transcoding
jobs for its audio and/or video are complete.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

date.description: Arbitrary date to associate with the media item.

deleted_at.description: Moment when the resource was deleted.

external_id.description: Unique identifier from a third-party source. Not populated in most media-items, but may have custom uses in certain apps.

external_m3u8_url.description: URL to a m3u8 playlist file.

legacy_id.description: Legacy identifier for the resource. Required by Podcasts.

outline_button_url.description: Destination URL for the first button.

podcast_guid.description: A unique identifier for a media item used in a podcast feed.

position.description: Location in Media Series item list, or `null` if draft.

published_at.description: Moment when the item was or will be published.

short_code.description: Short unique identifier. Can only be provided on media item creation. If omitted, it will be auto-generated.

slug.description: Slug of the media item for use in URLs

summary.description: Long-form text description of the media item. May include hyperlinks, paragraphs, and line breaks formatted as HTML.

summary_text.description: Text description of the media item, based on summary, with HTML removed.

tags.description:
Array of tags of the form `{type}:{title}`. See the Tag.type
documentation for supported types.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was last changed.

uses_live_vod.description: Indicates if the livestream's VOD has been removed.

web_video_button_url.description: Destination URL for the second button.

website_button_url.description: Destination URL for the third button.

MediaSeries.description: The Media Series type is used to contain a collection of Media Items.

href.description: A link to media-items belonging to the media series
A link to the current resource

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

deleted_at.description: Moment when the resource was deleted.

display_type.description: Method for displaying Media Items in series list.

legacy_series_list_id.description: Supports legacy method of grouping series.

media_items_count.description: Number of media items in the media series.

position.description:
Position where media series should appear in a manually-reordered
Smart List. If we manage to get rid of manually-oredered smart lists,
this can be deprecated.

published_at.description: Moment when the resource was or will be published.

published_media_items_count.description: Number of published media items in the media series.

slug.description: Slug of the media series for use in URLs

summary.description: Long-form text description of the media item. May include hyperlinks, paragraphs, and line breaks formatted as HTML.

summary_text.description: Text description of the media item, based on summary, with HTML removed.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was last changed.

MediaSeriesEndUserAccessRole.description: The MediaSeriesEndUserAccessRole is used to link an EndUserAccessRole to a MediaSeries resource.

MembershipStatusChange.description: A Membership Status Change is a resource that represents a point in time when a membership status changed for a given profile. It also includes metadata around any changes in membership status like when the change was effective.

Money.description: An object representing a monetary value with a value and currency units.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code representing the units for the money. Must be a supported currency for the payment account. (https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html)

value.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (that is, 100 cents for $1.00, or 1 for 1, Japanese Yen being a zero-decimal currency) representing the magnitude of money.

Notification.description: Notification is a representation of a push notification.

additional_description.description: Text that is displayed in the notification detail view in the app.

body.description: Text that is displayed in the notification on the lock screen, Notification Center, and inbox in the app.

created_at.description: Moment when the notification was created.

deleted_at.description: Moment when the notification was deleted.

displayed_count.description: Number of devices that displayed this notification.

is_live_stream_integrated.description: Whether the notification is integrated into a live stream.

minutes_before_published.description: Represents how many minutes before a livestream starts should the notification be sent.

opened_count.description: Number of devices that opened this notification.

pending_at.description: Moment when notification was marked as pending by the push agent.

published_at.description: Moment when notification will be sent by the push agent.

received_count.description: Number of devices that received this notification.

send_err_msg.description: The error that occurred when sending the notification

sent.description: Represents whether a message has been sent.

sent_at.description: Moment when notification was sent as recorded by the push agent.

sent_count.description: Number of devices this notification was sent to.

sns_message_ids.description: Unique identifiers assigned to the published message in SNS.

status.description: Computed property based on the notifications `published_at`, `pending_at`, `sent_at`, and `deleted_at` properties.

title.description: Title of a notification that is displayed and bolded at the top of the notification on the lock screen and in the Notification Center.

type.description: The Notification type for any special handling of the notification when sending, when unspecified a notification is handled normally.

updated_at.description: Moment when the notification was updated.

NotificationEmbedded.description: Embedded properties of the notification. Note when sending a notification to an `external-user`, `topic` is not allowed.

created_at.description: Moment when the pages link was created

deleted_at.description: Moment when the pages link was deleted

destination_url.description: The destination url of the pages link

id.description: Unique identifier of pages link object

published_at.description: The date and time the pages link was published

short_code.description: Short unique identifier of the pages link

status.description: The status of the pages link

subtitle.description: The subtitle of the pages link

title.description: The title of the pages link

type.description: The type of the pages link

updated_at.description: Moment when the pages link was updated

count.description: Number of resources on current page.

total.description: Total number of resources across all pages.

Payment.description: A payment resource is a recorded transfer of money from one party to another via a payment instrument to an account. Payments go through several states to track their progress based on interactions with the payfac and the instrument's issuing company.

donation.description: The donation that created this payment.

end-user.description: The user that made the payment. See <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/end-user-auth/#tag/EndUser>

instrument.description: The instrument used to make the payment. See <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Instrument>

payment-intent.description: The payment intent that created this payment.

profile.description: The profile of the end user that made the payment. See <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/people/#tag/Profile>

refunds.description: A list of all refunds related to this payment.

terminal.description: The terminal through which a payment was made. See <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Terminal>

amount.description: The money object specifying the amount and currency for the current payment.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code <https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html>, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency <https://stripe.com/docs/currencies> for the payfac and account.

value.description: The amount of funds transferred for the payment in whole units of the smallest unit of measure for the specified currency.

auth_code.description: The 6 character authorization_code from the credit card processor for card type payments.

auth_date.description: The timestamp that the payment occurred on in the timezone for the Organization at the time of payment.

check_number.description: When instrument type is `Check`, a check number may be included.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created in UTC.

error_reason.description: For failed/errored payments, this provides the reason as to why the payment failed.

fee.description: the money object specifying the amount and currency (should be the same as the amount) of the fee to be paid on this payment.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code <https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html>, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency <https://stripe.com/docs/currencies> for the payfac and account.

value.description: The payment fee collected by the payments platform in the same units as amount.

instrument_type.description: The type of payment instrument used to make the payment.

ip_address.description: The recorded ip address of the end user that initiated the payment.

memo.description: An optional message related to the payment. Often these are written on checks.
memo.example: For Chase and John's summer camp registration.

org_key.description: The identifier for the owning organization.

short_id.description: A unique and opaque integer identifier to be exposed to clients and end users for any use cases where using a UUID would not be appropriate.

state.description: DEPRECATED -> The state of the payment.

status.description: The readable status of a payment to display.

tax_deductible.description: Whether the payment is tax deductible or not. Payments from Giving will default to tax deductible.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated most recently.

PaymentAccount.description: An Account (or Client Gateway or just Gateway) is a resource that represents the configuration and options used to handle payments from an organization's terminal and to transfer funds from an end user to a client's PayFac account and finally to the client's bank account (Payment Source).

bank-account.description: The linked instrument resource for payouts to be paid to. See the Instrument model for the full description of fields. See <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Instrument>

id.description: The id for the owning organization.

terminals.description: The set of terminals that are configured to use this payment account. See <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/payments/#tag/Terminal>

card_fund_support.description: What kinds of card funds are supported by the payfac.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

currency.description: The selected currency for the payfac for payouts. The set of valid codes are defined in [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217).

disabled.description: A flag indicating if the Account is allowed to process payments or not. This is used to temporarily disable an account while the risk team is investigating potential fraud.

external_id.description: The external id of the payfac account.

instrument_support.description: The list of supported instrument types for the payfac.

legal_owner.description: The person declared as the legal owner of the account.

dob.description: The date of birth for the legal owner.

email.description: The email address of the legal owner. This field is used as a unique identifier for linking purposes with other resources that model persons in services.

first_name.description: The first name of the legal owner.

last_name.description: The last name of the legal owner.

tax_id.description: Last four of the SSN for US accounts and full SIN for CA accounts. Note that this field should be encrypted at rest.

more_info_required.description: A flag indicating if the Account requires more info indicated from Stripe.

org_key.description: The identifier for the owning organization.

payments_enabled.description: A flag indicating if the Account has payments enabled which means the Stripe account is fully activated and ready to process payments.

payout_schedule.description: A pseudo-resource for the schedule for which payouts are processed for the account. The payfac is responsible for managing these settings and executing the payouts at the specified schedule.

delay_days.description: The number of days charge funds are held before being paid out. May also be set to minimum, representing the lowest available value for the account country. Default is minimum. The delay_days parameter does not apply when the interval is manual.

interval.description: How frequently available funds are paid out.

weekly_anchor.description: The day of the week when available funds are paid out, specified as monday, tuesday, etc. (required and applicable only if interval is weekly.)

rates.description:
The rates information defines the base and customized fee options for a given payment account. The base rates are based on which tier (standard/giving_only) a client is a part of. The rate fee values are either percentage based or flat and apply when the platform executes payments of different types, using different instruments, and the payments service takes a portion of the amount transferred. The payments service controls what are known as the base rates, which are applied to the majority of accounts, but in some circumstances we negotiate custom rates with specific clients which the payments service applies on a per-account basis.

For example, if both credit.flat_fee and card.flat_fee are defined, but debit.flat_fee is not, then a payment with a credit card will use the rate from credit.flat_fee, but a payment with a debit card will use the rate from card.flat_fee because it's a type of card and there's no option defined for debit.flat_fee.

base.description: Our base rate values based on the value for the current tier. These values are used by the front end code when calculating the rates for donors-cover fees so that values for the custom rate negotiations aren't made public.

overrides.description: The per-client negotiated rate overrides. These values are used when calculating the per transaction fees charged to clients when communicating with the payfac.

tier.description: A pricing level type for the given client. This is based on what package the client is signed up for.

remote_deposits_enabled.description: A flag indicating if the Account is able to receive remote check deposits.

sic.description: The 4 digit SIC/Standard Industry Code. Note that this can be different from a MCC.

skip_ach_verification.description: If true, allows ACH accounts to be added by donors without the micro-deposit verification process usually required by stripe

acceptance_date.description: The time that the terms of service was accepted by the client.

ip.description: The ip address from which the client accepted the terms of service.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated most recently.

PaymentForm.description: A Payment Form represents the configuration options that allow for clients to process non-charitable payments. A Payment Form primarily controls the options presented to end users when using the form to submit a non-charitable payment.

PaymentIntent.description: This is the request/response body when creating a Payment Intent

account.description: The payment account that's associated with this Setup Intent

profile.description: The profile associated with this Payment Intent.  Either an existing profile ID or a combination of first, last, and email are required.

email.description: The email of the profile associated with this Payment Intent. Required for guests.

first_name.description: The first name of the profile associated with this Payment Intent. Required for guests.

last_name.description: The last name of the profile associated with this Payment Intent. Required for guests.

amount.description: The money object specifying the amount and currency for the current payment.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency for the payfac and account. For Check21 deposits from SmartPay RDC, the currency will ALWAYS be USD.

value.description: The integer amount of funds transferred for the payment in whole units of the smallest unit of measure for the specified currency.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created in UTC.

one_time.description: Whether or not this should be considered a one time payment. Always true for guest users.

verification_token.description: The captcha verification token for the Payment Intent.

PaymentUser.description:
DEPRECATED -> A Payment User is really just a JOIN table between an End User and a Payment Account so we will not be exposing this in the Payments API.

A payment user resource models a given end user in the domain of payments in a single organization and payment account. A payment user can be related to an Auth service App User, which allows a user to log in with a supported service (SS Login/Facebook/PCO).

Payout.description: A Payout (previously a transfer) is the transfer of funds from the payfac to a bank account. This can apply when funds a transferred for the platform's main subsplash account, or for a client's payout from their connected account to their bank account. A payout is applied or related to a group of payments/refunds/adjustments.

Payout2.description: A Payout is the transfer of funds from the payfac to a bank account. This can apply when funds are transferred for the platforms main subsplash account, or for a clients payout from their connected account to their bank account. A payout is applied or related to a group of payments/refunds/adjustments.

PhoneNumber.description: An unformatted phone number. Follows the [E.164](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en) standard which allows for up to 15 digits for a complete international phone number.

PhoneNumberCountry.description: Country information for a phone number.

calling_code.description: The international calling code with plus sign (e.g., "+1", "+44").

PhoneNumberWithCountryCode.description: A phone number object with country information and validation.

significant.description: The national number part of the phone number (without country code).

PlatformEndpoint.description: A Platform Endpoint represents the device end of a communication channel used for push notifications.

app_install_id.description: Unique ID of an app install. Required if `legacy_app_install_id` is not provided

created_at.description: Moment when the platform endpoint was created.

deleted_at.description: Moment when the platform endpoint was deleted.

id.description: The unique identifier of the platform endpoint

legacy_app_install_id.description: Unique ID of an app install (legacy). Required if `app_install_id` is not provided

token.description: Unique token assigned to the device after it registers with its corresponding push notification service (APNS, GCM, or FCM).

updated_at.description: Moment when the platform endpoint was last changed.

media-item.description: The related media item. Cannot be set for default resources.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

default.description: Whether or not this is a default or template resource. Only one default resource allowed per type and app_key. Default resources alow for clients to save defaults for a given resource, that can be recalled later to auto-fill fields for new resources.

display_duration_secs.description: The number of seconds a prompt should be shown for, before being hidden.

giving.description: The settings for a prompt with type set to 'give'. Not present for other types.

default_amounts.description: Denotes that the prompt will display the default amounts of $10, $50, $100, Custom. Setting this to false displays no amounts and provides an alternate experience with a tap/click that takes the user to the giving form with no pre-filled options.

trigger_time.description: The number of seconds into media at which the prompt should be shown.

type.description: The type of prompt. Only 'give' is supported at the moment.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated.

gross_given.description: gross sum of given gifts associated with this pledge.

PledgeUpdate.description: The update request for a Pledge. No fields are editable if related campaign in non-active state.

amount.description: Optional - Currency is not editable but is allowed on a request provided it matches.

Profile.description: The Profile is a resource that represents an organization's view of an EndUser. The data in this resource is completely owned by the client/organization, and edits are allowed by admins of the org.

address.description:
The related end user auth resource. <https://openapi.docs.subsplash.net/#tag/Address>
On Create operations, if an 'id' is provided then the linked address is checked for existence
and org_key matching and linked to the new profile. If no 'id' is provided, but values for
an address are provided in the _embedded, then the service will first attempt to create a
new address resource with the provided data, and upon success, the 'id' for that resource
will be used to link the new profile to the new address.

end-user.description: The related end user auth resource. <https://openapi.docs.subsplash.net/#tag/EndUser>

id.description: The id for the end user.

photo.description: The photo attached to this profile.

id.description: The id for the photo stored in the files service (accessible via the images service).

care_notes.description: Profile notes for special care information. These notes are indicated to the client as "private" in the dashboard. Note: this field is only displayed for child profiles.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

email.description: The primary email address of the user.

emails.description: The secondary/alternate email addresses of the user. Order is not kept.

external_id.description: A free form string field that allows for clients to reference a person in any arbitrary external system by that system's unique identifier. This field is readable and writable by clients and used to reference to some record in another 3P system they are using for importing data. This field is not validated, nor does any internal business logic depend on this field.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.

fluro_data.description: a hidden field used for additional fluro data included in this group

last_name.description: The last name of the user.

org_key.description: The identifier for the owning organization.

phones.description: The secondary/alternate phone numbers of the user. Order is not kept.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated most recently.

ProfileMaritalStatus.description:
The user's marital status.
- single
- married
- divorced
- separated
- widowed

ProfileRequest.description: The Profile is a resource that represents an organization's view of an EndUser. The data in this resource is completely owned by the client/organization, and edits are allowed by admins of the org.

address.description:
The related end user auth resource. <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/#tag/Address>
On Create operations, if an 'id' is provided then the linked address is checked for existence
and org_key matching and linked to the new profile. If no 'id' is provided, but values for
an address are provided in the _embedded, then the service will first attempt to create a
new address resource with the provided data, and upon success, the 'id' for that resource
will be used to link the new profile to the new address.

end-user.description: The related end user auth resource. <https://api-docs.subsplash.net/#tag/EndUser>

id.description: The id for the end user.

latest-membership-status-change.description: The latest membership status change resource connected to the profile.

photo.description: The photo attached to this profile.

id.description: The id for the photo stored in the files service (accessible via the images service).

care_notes.description:
Profile notes for special care information. These notes are indicated to the client as "private" in the dashboard.

Note: this field is only displayed for child profiles.

created_at.description: Moment when the resource was created.

custom_fields.description:
A list of custom field values associated with the profile. These fields
must be defined by a [CustomFieldDefinition](#tag/CustomFieldDefinition)
resource.

Note if the `custom_fields` array is present in the update request, the
custom fields data will be treated as all-or-nothing, meaning the data
present will overwrite what is currently stored on the Profile.

email.description: The primary email address of the user.

emails.description: The secondary/alternate email addresses of the user. Order is not kept.

external_id.description: A free form string field that allows for clients to reference a person in any arbitrary external system by that system's unique identifier. This field is readable and writable by clients and used to reference to some record in another 3P system they are using for importing data. This field is not validated, nor does any internal business logic depend on this field.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.

fluro_data.description: a hidden field used for additional fluro data included in this group

gender.description: The user's gender. Note that case and single-letter are normalized. Eg, "m" and "Male" will be normalized to "male".

last_name.description: The last name of the user.

org_key.description: The identifier for the owning organization.

phone.description: This field is deprecated in favor of `phone_number`.

phones.description: The secondary/alternate phone numbers of the user. Order is not kept.

updated_at.description: Moment when the resource was updated most recently.
